headline: Fish in Foil
description: Baked fish in foil is foolproof for tender, tasty fish every time. Try it with trout and jalapenos: Flavor and juices stay in, no fishy odor leaks out!

video.description: The baked fish in this recipe video is a "no-smell" fish recipe. Take foil packets to the table for service, and keep the packets around for wrapping and discarding bones and skin. Then when dinner's done just drop it in the trash.
video.name: How to Make Fish in Foil

name: Fish in Foil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Rinse and pat fillets dry. Rub fillets with olive oil, and season with garlic salt and black pepper. Place each fillet on a large sheet of aluminum foil. Top with jalapeno slices, and squeeze the juice from the ends of the lemon over fillets. Arrange remaining lemon slices on top of fillets.
Carefully seal all edges of the foil to form enclosed packets. Place packets on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes depending on size of fillets.

review.reviewBody: The recipe was great. I used spices I liked and lemon juice. Also, you have to remember to adjust the oven temperature to your oven. My oven runs hotter so I set it at 385*. Cleanup was quick and the smell was minimal. Heck, the cats didn't even know I had fish till I was eating it. Pairs well-steamed garlic kale

The recipe was super easy and delicious. I tweaked it a little by using fresh diced tomatoes and red onions. I couldn’t use the jalapeños and cilantro I had, so I improvised. It turned out great my honey loved it! Personally rockfish is not the tastiest. It’s kind boring fish not tasty but the extra ingredients made the fish delicious. I also added chopped garlic. I will make this recipe with steelhead or salmon next time. Thanks for a great and easy recipe.
So good, so easy! One of my favorite ways of cooking fish!
Sounds delicious!
I didn't have lemons but I did have some lemon juice. Added a little more seasoning, paprika, tiny amount of cayenne. Sooo good.
Not too bad. I played with the recipe a bit to suit my taste.
Use Steelhead trout. No changes. Absolutely delicious.
This was great, the only change I made was I used garlic powder as I didn't have garlic salt. I added a sprinkle of salt. I will definitely be making this again.
Great, easy recipe that came out tasting really nice.
Great recipe! Tip: Foil is commonly known to be toxic and leach into your food, this also applies to other metals from scratched pans with coatings removed.
I made this as written. It was good, but next time I'll add some dill or cilantro to give it more pizzaz.
I substituted salmon. Very easy and delicious. Will be trying it next by adding asparagus.
Added a cup of white wine and cooked wrapped in foil on the BBQ for about 20 minutes. Heavenly...
I added parsley instead of the peppers and added Old Bay Garlic Seasoning

Very good of course i think i may have used to much lemon but either way it was absolutely wonderful, so on my second piece i added some garlic power and that was phenomenal as well. Will definitely be making this again. Yumm
Easy way to cook fish.
I changed the items to squash and asparagus - then wrapped in foil
Absolutely fantastic...the only thing I did differently is I drizzled the filet with melted butter after it was cooked....magnificent!
Awesome recipe. I make it with tilapia and it’s ALWAYS A HIT and sooo easy to make. Thank you for sharing!
Exceptional !
This was the first time I cooked with fresh fish and it turned out really well! Very flavorful, and the fish flaked off easily. I will definitely make this again!
Hubby loved this! Thanks for the great recipe!

I followed a review made by another - drizzled the fish with lemon juice, seasoned with salt, pepper, garlic powder, topped with thin slices of lemon, then butter and seeded jalepeno pepper slices. Wrapped it up and baked my fillets (about a half pound each) at 400 F for 20 minutes. Turned out perfect, just drained the packets before serving. Even my picky eater who usually dislikes fish likes this!! Will definitely make this again!! Thanks!
Follow recipe. Super easy, really good! Definitely will keep in the rotation.

Delicious! Used red pepper strips and thinly sliced onion, 2” thick cod on top, then drizzle olive oil, little fresh lemon juice, S,P, parsley,lemon thyme, lemon slices. 20 mins then added 5 more as cod was thick. 
A source said internal temp for fish is 145, approximately 10 minutes per inch
made this several times, however, all i do is drizzle french dressing, topped with sliced onion, salt and pepper, and not necessarily in that order...so good!

I use this recipe but I modified a bit. I use red chilies instead of jalapeños (because I like it that spicy) and dory fish. Me and my husband love it! 

But I do think I need to tone down the spiciness a bit next time haha. I was too excited!
Simple and delicious. I used flounder and pollock, jarred jalapeños,

As written, it's a little bland if you can't do jalapenos, which we can't in our family. But it's a very nice base and cooks the trout really well. I added sliced onions and fennel and some more seasonings to the fish before wrapping in the foil otherwise it was too plain (I can see where jalapenos will take care of a alot of that issue). The cooking time and method was spot on and the fish came out flaky and moist and delicious. Will continue to add and modify in different ways but always use this method.

Really quick and easy. Instead of regular olive oil, I used a garlic and herb basting oil (from Wegmans). I made two filets.. In one of the packets, I added a handful of grape tomatoes. Delicious both ways! Definitely will make again.
Quick and easy. I loved it. Also tripled the jalapeños.

I'm not a fish person (though I wish I was considering the health benefits!), but I did enjoy this recipe. It was very easy to make, and it is robust enough that I was able to add different vegetables to the packets for some of my family members and it still turned out good. I used lemon juice instead of sliced lemon since some other reviews said the slices were too strong. I also added dill (first time ever in a recipe) and I highly suggest others try it. It definitely kicks this up a notch! I used jalapeños in some packets, and bell pepper in other. Finally, I suggest seasoning both sides of the fish. I found that when I only seasoned one side, the fish I used came out a little too fishy for my taste. I also live inland, and I have to buy frozen fish, so that might be why mine needs extra seasoning.
Great dinner
Following some reviews, I used Mahi Mahi instead and it was delicious! I will definitely make that again!
Not practical with rainbow trout. Fillets too thin. Use just about any other fillet.o additional liquid other than from lemon. Try with orange and/or lime.
I made this for my family and they loved it. This is definitely one I will make again. It was easy and tasty as is. No revisions necessary.

Easy..delicious..I used 1 and 1/2 pounds haddock fillets....we added tomatoes..onions black olives chopped sweet red pepper ...plenty of lemon and olive oil salt pepper,and greek seasonings....timing perfect..served with red bliss potatoes I microwaved in butter with seasonings...soooo good!!!
Tasty. Prefer a bit more seasoned but excellent technique!

Made with 4 tilapia filets. Baked for about 24 minutes as the tilapia goes straight from the freezer to oven. Use less jalapeno next time, I used 4 slices per filet and it was too much! Also, cut down on the garlic salt to less than 1 t. Made with corn as a side.

Excellent flavor. I used Basa and you must use fresh jalapeño .
And fresh lemon. I did add some dill, a family favorite.
Thank you for Sharing.
Love the lemon. It's very flavorful.
This was super bomb. I made a few changes. Used lemon pepper, garlic pepper, garlic powder and a lil sea salt. Followed rest of ingredients.
Really easy & yummy!
Love it! Easy to prepare and clean up. Tasty!!!
THE best easy to do fish recipe! I couldn't believe the flavor using Tilapia...try it!
Thank you for this idea! It worked great!
A wonderful recipe. You should add 10 - 15 min if your fish is frozen.

This is a really nice recipe! Fast to prepare if you have the ingridients ready! If you want a more lemoney taste I suggest adding lemon pepper seasoning. Also Make sure to add the correct amount of salt to give that great taste!

400 degree's for 15-20 min was perfect. I sort of followed taste king's review and sauteed 4-5 TBSP of olive oil with a TBSP of minced garlic, lemon zest of one lemon for about 3-4 minutes. After removing from heat, added garlic pepper and a bit of cajun seasoning. Brushed both sides of fish with oil mixture, added 1/2 slice of lemon, fresh jalapeno and onion. Huge hit with husband and 8 year old son! Next time I'll add more onion to the packets. Served with asparagus and rosemary crusty bread.
Delicious and so simple too. Thanks for the recipe!

Made this with some trout my husband & I caught the other day. Used to eat a lot of fish at home (from the east cost of Canada), and it is quite expensive here in Utah, so I was happy to get some fresh caught trout! Wish we could eat fish more. I love lemon with fish, I squirted quite a bit of lemon juice on it but I really like the lemon taste with it. Thought it was very tasty. Put it in for about 18 mins and it came out perfect.
This was very good but I used Cod left off the peppers, but I did sprinkle with red pepper flakes.
Now we can have trout at home instead of at a restaurant--it was just as good. Thanks!!
this has been my go to fish recipe for several years now. Great every time.
Giving it 5 for the simplicity of the recipe and the outcome. Flavour was great. Fish cooked perfectly. This is a keeper for us. Thanks Denyse.
This recipe is delicious but to others who are planning on making this, don't wrap the fish too tight in tin foil because it will take much longer to cook!

So simple and delish!!! I love the fact that you don't actually have to marinate the chicken I had of time the flavors just meld together while you are baking! I added fresh basil red onions and zucchini to my packets and it turned out amazing!!
Easy and delicious. Each person adds what they want for veggies to their own serving so we all get what we want.

I totally spaced the olive oil but it still turned out pretty well. I though it was a bit too spicy but my boyfriend loved it. I might make a packet without jalapeno for me next time. It was very easy to make. I added some fresh basil and Greek oregano from our garden and some sliced sweet onion. I did not find there was too much liquid.

delicious, i added parsley -very easy to make- i had it with noodles. =P i only used 1 lemon for 6 pieces of tilapia filet and i thought it was too much. otherwise, its a simple meal for guest and family.
This was very delicious. I loved it. I will definitely be making this again.

We tried the recipe tonight and found it to be delicious. This is really surprising because we were a non fish eating family. We are saving this recipe. Very moist fish. When I cooked it I cooked a whole trout(small) instead of fillets because I don't know how to cut them. The skin came right off and the bones came out easily and in tact. thanks for the recipe

Very good. I use salmon too and put a tsp. of butter on top, spice it up with salt pepper and garlic and dill weed. Slice lemon rings 1/4 in. and lay on top. Simple. Seal tin foil edges and bake in the oven with your chips on baking sheet. Kill two fish with one stone (LOL)

very bland but an easy lazy way of cooking 
would imagine this would be good if your out camping

Very good. I used Black Drum that my son caught when he went to Rockport. I love how the jalapeños added flavor without heat. My husband opted not to use the jalapeños on his and added paprika instead. Also very good. We opened the foil packets for the last few minutes of baking.

It turned out great! I didn't have olive oil so I used regular vegetable oil and garlic paste instead of the salt. I wasn't expecting it to work out so well but everybody liked it! I followed one of the comments here by first sauteeing the garlic and lemon zest in oil, then adding crushed black pepper, salt, red chillies and lemon juice at last.
Looks sophisticated, tastes delicious, is actually very easy to prepare, as most fish is :)
This was great. I used fresh trout. I would use a tad less olive oil and no lemon for my man..i however love lemon also added a little old bay and garlic it was wonderful! i will make again and again
I had no idea that jalapeños lemon and trout would work so well together. My husband does not like fish but loved this!
Made this because my Boyfriend loves fish and jalapeno's....it was a hit. Wonderful flavors. You can add and change tastes if you like. But this dish was great!
Hubby really liked it.
this did not work for me, did not like the flavor or soggy texture.

This recipe is soooooo good! My boyfriend absolutely loves this I fix it for him all the time! This is so quick and easy! I do leave the jalapeños off my trout though. That just means extra for him! ;)
Very easy to prepare and clean up was a snap.
Easy and delicious. Made the recipe as written.
Wonderful recipe, add slices of jalapeno inside the fish as well....Outstanding

I love to hear "You can make this again, Mom"! That is what my 14 year old said. I don't hear that often. Made it with Tilapia and also had some Hake (like Cod) left in the freezer. It was great with both kinds of fish. This is a keeper!
Simple and Yummy. Enough said.

I can't even describe how delicious these little bundles were:) My husband had just come back from a fishing trip and had 2 beautiful rainbow trout to cook up. I followed this recipe but also added a bunch of chopped red onion to the bundles and fresh garlic cloves stuffed in the cavity as well as a sprig of fresh dill. I was skeptical about all of the strong flavors coming together but they did and I told my husband he had to go fishing more so I could make this dish again:) Thanks!

Good recipe for fish. I used cod, seasoned well with salt, pepper and garlic powder, put plenty of jalapeno slices (without seeds) over top and used lime instead of lemon. When done, I put the fish with jalapeno's over white rice and squeezed more lime and added fresh cilantro to give it more of a Caribbean flavor. It was delicious.
I loved this except I don't like jalapenos so I omitted them.

I loved this recipe!!! Quick and delicious! I substituted the lemon with diced pineapple and the jalapeno pepper with a 1/2 cup premade medium salsa.... added a pinch of lemon pepper seasoning and reduced the amount of garlic salt to 1 tsp. but I'm sure the original recipe would have been fantastic; I only substituted due to the ingredients I had in my pantry... after all I'm only an average college girl I can't afford to splurge on one meal (:

Everything came out a bit watery and sloppy. The jalapeno slices were mush. The flavors overall didn't really excite me. The only reason I'm not rating this recipe lower is that the fish filets themselves really did cook up nicely, perfectly flaky. I think therefore that this general cooking method has a lot of promise, but I will look around for a different variation.

My own stupidity, I should have realized the amount of salt in it. I scaled it for 6 servings and WOW it was nasty salty. I added the dill weed suggested by some and used a poblano instead of jalapeno. Very good recipe and a keeper with 1/4 the amount of salt.
Quick- easy & delicious! Left off the jalapeno & used Salmon. Will make this again & again I am sure, with whatever fish I have on hand. And the very best part.....Easy clean up!
Loved it - so easy, clean, and perfectly cooked. I added some white wine, zucchini, yellow squash, tomatoes, and red peppers as well. Tasted great!

I used Swai (which is a form of catfish) didn't have lemon so I used lemon pepper seasoning, garlic powder and jalapenos and cooked for 20 minutes. My hubby said it was awesome! Served with wild rice.

Pretty good - clean up is wonderful! I used a couple cloves of fresh garlic. Also added thin sliced onion. Took a lot longer than 20 minutes, but I was using steelhead trout which is much larger than rainbow.
Good recipe. Simple to put together and make for an easy dinner. Will use this idea again but with different seasonings.
Wow! I only saw 3 whole rainbow trout so that is what I used. Simple with a slight jalapeno taste. I did deseed/devein the jalapeno because the kids aren't fans.
delicious! will def make again :)
The lemon was refreshing, the jalapeno was just enough spice! This was quick and easy, and had a nice flavor!
Very easy. Simple and tasty meal. I served on a bed of brown rice with a side of steamed veggies. Husband enjoyed it. Thanks for sharing this!
Used bottled lemon juice and pickled jalapenos. Also, Ms. Dash Table Blend. Was very good. Thanks for posting!
Delicious and easy to make!
very very easy, and very tasty
so simple and had a great kick! i used tilapia.
didn't have jalapeno peppers - but it still excellent without them
This was just OK for me and my husband. Not enough flavor for us. I'm sure I could doctor it up. But as is, not a winner for me. Sorry
